svg.text: Time & Space Complexity Analysis with Big O Notation

g.text: • Predict performance before implementation • Compare efficiency of different algorithms
• Make informed decisions about algorithm selection • Optimize resource utilization
• Time Complexity: How execution time grows with input size
• Space Complexity: How memory usage grows with input size
Measures how the execution time of an algorithm grows as the input size increases
Expressed using Big O notation to describe the upper bound of growth rate
for i in range(len(arr)): # O(n) iterations
Best Case: O(1) - found at index 0
Worst Case: O(n) - not found or last
Measures how the memory usage of an algorithm grows with input size
Includes both auxiliary space and space needed to store input
Example: Array of size n = O(n)
Time Complexity: O(n) × O(n) × O(1) = O(n²)
Space Complexity: O(1) - only loop variables
Total operations: n² comparisons + n² prints
Time Complexity: T(n) = T(n-1) + O(1) = O(n)
Space Complexity: O(n) - recursive call stack
Stack depth: n function calls stored in memory
Time Complexity: O(log n) - divides search space
Space Complexity: O(1) - only a few variables
Iterations: log₂(n) - halves problem each time
Usually most important for algorithm comparison
Sometimes use more space to save time
Complexity analysis helps choose the right algorithm for your problem size and performance requirements
Remember: Premature optimization is the root of all evil, but understanding complexity is essential for scalable solutions
